15533222222221122212122211122.content:
Mizore fell to the ground, in absolute pain. "Ha. Looks like we got you, You son of a bitch!" Kurumu panted. "So, kill me." Mizore said, not crying, just laying sternly. Kurumu sheathed her Succubus Claws. "I think our the Person you shrunk would rather." was all Kurumu said. Ruby removed Tsukune from her chest, and Tsukune stood sternly, eyes closed.

"Him?! Tsukune would never murder his girlfriend!" Mizore laughed. "And Besides, at his size, he couldn't even kill a fly." "YOU'RE WRONG MIZORE!" Tsukune yelled in anger. "Don't you remember, Moka gave me her blood, so not only am I part human, I am part Vampire." Everyone gasped, they had all forgotten that Tsukune had been given Vampire Blood by Moka.

"So, you wouldn't actually..kill me..right?" Mizore said, now fearing Tsukune's Power. "Not if you return me to normal, right..now." Tsukune said, grinning, the top and bottoms of his teeth, beginning to spurt vampire teeth. "There's no antidote." Mizore said, face darkened. "You brought this upon yourself." Tsukune said.

Mizore feared the worst, and Tsukune did the worst. Tsukune jumped from Ruby's hand, to Mizore's shoulder. "So, your going to suck my blood." Mizore said, before her blood was sucked straight from her body. Tsukune stood back up, and the drained Mizore crumbled to dust.

"Wow, I guess Moka can be your girlfriend now." Kurumu admitted, she was only interested in Humans and Succubi like herself. "I never expected you to say that." Tsukune said. "I didn't either." Kurumu said.

The Girls and Tsukune returned to Moka's room, and Tsukune jumped from Ruby's shoulder to Moka's hands. "Tsukune! I'm glad you made it back!" Moka said, rubbing Tsukune against her face, then kissing him. She then smelt him. "You don't smell the same." Moka said. "And I have the other Moka to thank for it." Tsukune said, smiling and bearing the Vampire teeth.

"What Tsukune?" Moka (The one in the Rosary) said. "You gave me your blood remember?" Tsukune said. "Well, there's a surefire test." Moka said. She didn't exactly believe Tsukune just yet. "What the other Moka is saying is, that if your vampire, then pull the Rosary off using a vampire's natural super-strength." Moka (The Current One) said.

"Alright." Tsukune said. Moka lowered her body to where Tsukune was, and Tsukune was able to pull off the Rosary with brute force. Moka transformed into her other self, and was shocked with Tsukune.

"Great job Tsukune." Moka said, "But we need to get a Rosary for you. The transformation for you has already begun." Tsukune didn't notice it at the time, but his hair became a silvery white, much like Moka's, and his eyes, they became red, also as Moka's.

3 hours after Tsukune's full transformation, Moka called her father, and he sent her a Tiny Rosary, attached to a steel necklace. Tsukune placed it around his neck, and he instantly changed to his human form. "Cool," Tsukune said. "And, since your part human, You can pull both your Rosary, and My Rosary off, and we will both transform." Moka said.

"Cool." Tsukune repeated. Moka placed the Rosary back on, and turned back into the other Moka. "Guys, I think Tsukune should stay with me." Moka said. "And why is that?" Yukari said. "Because you guys have powers, and I'm useless without my Rosary Power. Tsukune can pull his, and mine off." Moka explained. The 3 girls talked about it, and agreed Tsukune should stay with Moka.

That one night, Tsukune sat on the windowsill, and Moka slept in her bed. "Moka's so cute, especially when she sleeps." Tsukune said, looking in the Moonlight.

Skip to Daytime?

Tsukune said. Moka got up, and she had been in a nightgown. "Now Tsukune, unless you try the pervert crap again, please turn around so I can change." Moka said.

Tsukune did the respectful thing, and turned around, when he turned back, Moka was in her Saturday Clothes. "Hey Tsukune, do you think we should call your family, and alert them about this?" Moka asked. "No. No-one other than our friends should know." Tsukune said. Tsukune checked the Rosary around his neck, and tried pulling it, but it wouldn't budge.

"HEY!" a voice from inside Tsukune's Rosary said. "Woah!" Tsukune shouted, toppling over. "Ha! Always works." the voice said. "Hey, are you my Monster Forme?" Tsukune asked. "Yeah, lemme explain. The Moka you see there, is a phantom of her real self." the voice said. "So, you're basically the Vampire Forme of me, and I'm now the Phantom of my real self?" Tsukune said.

"Wow Kid, You learn fast." the voice said. "But in this Rosary, it allows you to change sizes, but not your own, at will." "That sounds pretty cool, except for the not being able to change myself to normal part." Tsukune said. "But, I do know the ingredients for a reversal potion." the voice said. "Sweet!" Tsukune said. "Just get the the Chem Lab, then pull me off, I will allow you to there." the voice said.

Tsukune walked into his classroom and saw that the room was empty. Well except for his amazing teacher, Mrs. Nekonome of course! She had her back to him and was working on something in the back. "Mrs. Nekonome!" Tsukune called. The beautiful, cat like teacher yelped and turned around in a flash. "Oh it's just you Tsukune! What is it that you need?" She asked and Tsukune approached her. "Mrs. Nekonome I need to tell you something important." Tsukune said and grabbed his teacher's hands. She blushed at the handsome young man's abrupt approach. "What is it Mr. Aono? Is something wrong?" She grabbed his hands as well and looked into his eyes. "I may have lots of girls in my life but...I love you the most Mrs. Nekonome! Would you do me the honor of kissing me?" Tsukune yelled and grabbed his teacher's hands tighter.

"Mr. Aono...thank you. But that wouldn't be right. Your my student and...I can't." She said and regretted it. She wanted this hot young thing really badly. "But Mrs. Nekonome there must be some way!" Tsukune begged and a thought popped into his teacher's head. "Well how about I make it so that you can be mine forever?" She asked and grabbed something from the desk behind her. "I would love that Mrs. Nekonome!" Tsukune cheered. "Okay then, from now on call me Kitty Kat okay?" As she spoke she sprinkled magic dust all over Tsukune and the boy blacked out.

15533222222221122222121.content:
a beautiful girl with long luxuriant hair that was a rich shade of crimson and was set in a style that complemented and drew attention to her face rather nicely with her hair bound by bandages at where her ears where while the rest of her hair was unbridled and hung in braids on either side of her face and a long ponytail down to her mid-back. As for the rest of her heart-shaped face, she had a button nose, her lips were full and blood red, and topaz colored eyes. She wore a large, black sleeveless shirt with a white trim and black interior, black kung-fu shoes, followed by a matching black skirt with skin-tight black pants on as well as the skirt for decency's sake. She seemed lithe, agile, and slim. Her bare arms showed small signs of muscle, a mere ripple to prove that she did work out. Her legs showed definite signs of training underneath the black pants she wore, they were amazingly toned, long, tender, and juicy. Added on to all that, slung across her back was a Bo-staff.

However, seeing her made Tsukune want to wet his pants on account of one fact: She was a member of the Student Police Committee! He'd seen her here and there, but couldn't remember her name. Tsukune's heart sank as she reached down and grabbed him by the back of his school uniform's shirt and brought him to her eye-level.

"Hello Anao...in trouble again I see." The girl snickered.

At her words, Tsukune started thrashing and squirming like mad, until a thought struck him.

"Wait a minute...how were you able to find me?"

The girl rolled her eyes "I'm a Jiang Shi, I can find people by smelling when they breath, small-fry. You saw me transform when I took on that little witch friend of yours."

"Sorry, I was...kinda busy so I didn't notice. Kuyou trying to kill you can do that to a person...um...sorry, but I don't know your name."

"Its Deshiko Deshi, I'm one of the Four Kings of the student police committee."

"Um...wouldn't that make you a queen then?" Tsukune asked.

"Ugh, I hate technicalities..." Deshiko sighed in irritation.

"Heheh...sorry."

Deshiko studied Tsukune intently. "So...is size-changing part of your true nature or something?"

"No...I'm a Ghoul alright. I...I can't control myself unless I'm in human form." Tsukune defended.

Deshiko winced. A Ghoul was a mindless, killing machine--a berserker, bent on seeking blood and driven by nothing but a pure, uncontrollable desire to kill, unable to distinguish friend from foe. The only way to stop a rampaging ghoul is to kill it. What made it worse was that Ghouls where S-class monsters the same way vampires and werewolves were. It was vital he stay in human form enough for everyone to think he really was human if that was the case.

"Why didn't you say anything when Kuyou arrested you back during your freshmen year?"

"Not only was it against the rules, I hate that I'm a Ghoul, if the student police committee knew they would've killed me anyways, and Kuyou wouldn't have CARED, he forced he to watch as you committee guys tortured my friends unless I agreed to say I was human. I had to brake the first seal on my Ghoul powers when Kuyou nearly killed my friends at the end of my freshmen year, after that, it got so bad the headmaster had to give me a holy lock."

The redhead cringed, that was Kuyou alright. Sadistic to the core and twisted enough to do that to someone. It would've been a bloodbath if he had transformed at any time if he had decided to show Kuyou what he was, it was for everyone's sake he refused to try being anything other than human while he was here. Kuyou, in his "wisdom", had nearly killed everyone by letting out a Super-monster berserker...the thought made her shutter. What was worse was that Kuyou held grudges enough to be an Uchiha...and those back-stabbing copycats where evil by the standards of the creatures trapped in hell!

"Say Deshiko Deshi...what're you going do to me?" Tsukune asked her, thankfully bringing her out of her morbid thoughts.

Deshiko thought about it and decided...
15533222222221122222121.title: The Encounter with Deshi

choices: "Between my breasts, that's gonna be the highlight of your day"
"You deserve nothing more than my feet. You need to start living like a slave."
155332222222211222221211.content:
Deshiko looked away, staring blankly at the clouds. "You know....the Student Police are a joke now thanks to you. Everyone's saying we're a joke and since Kuyou is still recovering we can't really do anything about it?"

In Deshiko's palm Tsukune cringed slightly, his memory was nonexistant of what he did to Kuyou but he was given a vivid description; Kuyou was lucky to be alive, he might not even return until the next semester. No wonder he hadn't seen any signs of the Student Police lately. "I'm sorry......."

Deshiko used her free hand to flick Tsukune lightly, "No you aren't. You should be but you aren't. It was either him or you, hunt or be hunted. That's the way of the monster. No matter how much you hated him you're the kind of guy that hates fighting, you want to be sorry, but you aren't."

Tsukune's mind reeled like he was taking an impossible test, "No me and my friends we-"

"Unite to fight other monsters." the giantess finished, "You guys act like saints and might even be but the fact remains you guys are no different from us."

The shrunken human/monster gulped loudly, "Um... you never answered. What are you going to do to me?" Tsukune desperately wanted to change the topic.

Deshiko's eyes locked onto Tsukune like a snake that had found their prey, "You took out my groups leader. I'll take yours in return. You're coming with me for some fun. I always wanted a little pet, not to mention you have to pay a little bit for Kuyou."

"You have got to be joking!" At the mercy of this girl of all people? Tsukune had no luck!

Leaning forward slightly Deshiko eyed Tsukune with a cold stare, "I never joke. Because of you the Student Police- I am a laughing stock, a grunt again. I want some control again, even if it's just having a slave."

Mentally Tsukune was freaking out. At the mercy of this power craving freak? He'd rather deal with Vampire Moka, Mizore and Kurumu a hundred times over. Deshiko saw Tsukune having a panic attack and merely shrugged, " Your reaction is understandable. It takes time to adjust to worshipping a goddess. But to properly worship we need to be somewhere private, my own home isn't very far off you know."

Tsukune paled at what she was getting at, "Please don't..."

Deshiko grinned evilly, "Slaves don't get a say in the matter. But where shall I keep you during the trip? I can't exactly hold you open to the public."

Tsukune opened his voice but Deshiko jammed her finger into his jaw to silence him, knocking him back. "I said slaves don't get a vote. I say you hitch a ride....
155332222222211222221211.title: Deshiko's new toy

choices: The bus drops Deshiko off at her house
the bus runs out of gas before they get to Deshiko's house
1553322222222112222212111.content:
Tsukune opened his voice but Deshiko jammed her finger into his jaw to silence him, knocking him back. "I said slaves don't get a vote. I say you hitch a ride between my breasts, that's gonna be the highlight of your day."

Tsukune turned a mix between a blush and a blanch with some unhealthy shade of green mixed in. "NO WAY! I'M NOT VIOLATING YOU LIKE THAT!"

Deshiko looked at him in shock. A blush involuntarily creeping to her cheeks. He was actually treating it that way? She still hated his guts for what happened, but now she was beginning to see why four girls all liked him. Hmm...powerful and decent...reminded her of HIM. That friend of hers she'd come to call "Baka-Sama" as her personal nickname for him, which eventually became an affectionate term she used for her good friend, Kami knew it was a better nickname than the one his first name had given him. Honestly, who named they're kid after a raman topping? Still...she found it hilarious seeing him blow a gasket every time he was called "Mr.Fishcake"...heheeh. Shame he wasn't able to see her with what was going on in his world. To hide her blush at the thought of her friend, she scoffed, making it look like she was upset with Tsukne for disobeying her.

"The choice isn't yours. I swear, you and Baka-Sama would get along swell..."

"Huh?" Tsukune tilted his head in confusion Baka-Sama? As in "Lord Idiot"? Who was that?

Deshiko hummed to herself. "Well I GUESS I could use a new insole if that doesn't sound good. Ghoul are repulsive and nearly mindless, but they ARE S-class monsters so you should be able to take a lot of pain..."

Tsukune nearly fainted in terror, he'd used the effects of Moka giving him some of her blood and granting him powers as an effective coverstory that he was human, but he wished it wasn't biting him on the butt with that suggestion. Not to mention his transformation into a Ghoul happened if he was ever in a life-threatening situation. And being repeatedly crushed under Deshiko's foot SURE seemed to fit the bill.

"Survival-triggered transformation?" Deshiko asked with a raised eyebrow.

Tsukune nodded.

"Well then..." Deshiko said cheerfully, heading into the girl's bathroom with a smile that was so wide it made her shut her eyes, "What's the real problem? You can keep your eyes shut the whole time. What's wors: feeling awkward or becoming a Ghoul?"

Tsukune groaned at her logic, hating she was right. He clamped his eyes shut as tightly as possible as soon as Deshiko had opened the door, he heard and felt her walking then the sound of a stall door opening.

"Hey Deshiko...how are you able to find your way around with your eyes closed?" Tsukune asked, trying to keep his mind off his eventual fate as he heard the stall door being shut and locked and he felt her set him down.

"Jiang shi are blind and locate their victims by their breath, added on to that, every member of my race has photographic memories." Deshiko explained. "Fortunately, We're only blind when we're in our true forms AND we keep our photographic memories in human form."

"Victims?" Tsukune repeated faintly.

"Relax, Jiang shi feed off the life force energy of others by sucking they're breath. But these days , you need to be overly obsessed with it to feed off pets. We preferred humans during the feudal era, but as time passed we learned we can eat regular food and be satisfied with it so we don't need chi-sucking unless its urgent to the point of surviving not being available any other way, like if we get our chests torn open by an attack or get ripped in two. We'd need to suck the chi of others to heal it." Deshiko said.

Tsukune sighed in relief, emergency only draining. That was good news. He found himself picked up again and after a moment, felt a wall of warm skin pressing against his back and he was pinned there by something tight. He tried not to go red in the face or think about just where he was. The rustle of fabric and the stall being opened told him Deshiko was finished but he kept his eyes shut anyway, He felt movement again for a long time. then Tsukune heard what was unmistakably the sound of a bus door opening. He felt as the redheaded Jiang shi boarded the bus and felt it move.

Tsukune shuttered. He'd assumed Deshiko was heading back to her dorm and he'd eventually be able to escape and get help. However, he wasn't that lucky.

Deshiko was taking him home with her.
1553322222222112222212111.title: Facts about Jiang shi, hiding places,& destinatios

15533222222221122222121111.content:
The journey itself wasn't really all that bad, just very long and overall boring. Deshiko absentmindedly stared out the window at the gloomy landscape, smiling as she thought of what she could do to her slave. At first Tsukune was so fixated on not trying to imagine his position between the girl's breasts and becoming some sort of pervert but after the first hour or so he finally settled down enough that he could be considered calm. His eyes still remained shut and his cheeks were still red but he wasn't sweating like he was having a seizure anymore; in fact in kinda felt nice, soft,safe, secure, very pleasant. It took a ton of self control for Tsukune not to break out in a nosebleed although the situation was growing dull.

Soon enough Deshiko became bored too, thinking of ways to play with her pet was fun for the first thirty minutes or so but after that it just became repetitive. Any little thing Deshiko could do could be turned into a fun little game/torture session, sitting down, walking, eating, even basic hygene, mentally she imagined each and every little scenario and while they would be tremendous fun it was not fun just thinking about it, she wanted to do it but being on a bus that was not smart. It's not like the bus was crowded either, just Deshiko, Tsukune, and the creepy bus driver so there was no one to talk to. Before she knew it Deshiko fell asleep, her dreams of torturing Tsukune the closest she could get to the real thing for now.

"Wake up, it's your stop!"

Grunting a little bit Deshiko stirred awake, checking through touch whether or not Tsukune was still secure between her breasts, he was. Rising from the seat Deshiko stretched and reached for her belongings, slinging the bag around her shoulder and walking to the front of the bus.

She began leaving the bus as soon as she got to the front but behind her the bus driver could be heard talking. "Have fun you two." Deshiko turned pale white at that statement, quickly rushing off the bus. Without any more comments the Bus Driver began chuckling like he knew everything and drove away, the smoke from his cigar flowing from the windows,

"He knew and he didn't help me!!!!" Tsukune roared mentally, struggling in his soft prison.

Feeling her prisoners soft movements Deshiko giggled as she put a finger against her chest, specifically against Tsukune to hold him in place. "There there my pet, I'm sure you wanna come out and get on with the worship but wait til I pull you out first."

Tsukune stopped struggling, wearing a melodramatic expression, "Where's Moka when you need her?!" He whimpered.

Deshiko heard a low mumbling from him but thought nothing of it as she innocently walked into her home. Shockingly her house was similar to the typical human home, nicely kept, clean, a spot for shoes up front, the usual. She entered this humble abode lost in the demonic looking realm like nothing was wrong. Right upon entering the giantess placed her stuff by the door and slipped her shoes off, walking along the house still wearing a smile.

"Just so you know I live alone so don't expect help." She sneered, enjoying kicking her pet while he was down.

Again like on the bus Deshiko's mind pondered how to properly torture her pet. On the bus she had some unique ideas such as making Tsukune worship her feet all the way up to her scalp; the idea was nice but it may end up kind of boring due to Tsukune being so small. Sure the idea of him licking between her toes and massaging her entire body seemed nice but in reality it would take forever.

Another possible idea was simply some games, Cat and Mouse, Truth or Dare, Hide and Seek, so many human games could be very fun with such a small slave. Not to mention it was practically a guaranteed win for Deshiko.

"Hrhm....Worship or games?" She wondered aloud, giving Tsukune goosebumps at the choices she was contemplating.
15533222222221122222121111.title: Arrival, Now what?

choices: Deshiko starts out with something simple yet amusing--truth or dare
155332222222211222221211112.content:
Deciding she wanted to start off with having some fun, Deshiko made up her mind. She took him out and set him on a desk and pulled up a chair and looked at her slave with the intensely of a hawk. Tsukune shuttered...he didn't like that bright smile that forced Deshiko to shut her eyes.

"Did you enjoy the ride?" she asked cheerfully.

"I still feel like I violated you. But I understand you were trying to be nice." Tsukune said, he didn't want to upset her and he had to admit the Jiang-Shi COULD have put him somewhere more unpleasant, but he felt indecent for being there.

Deshiko giggled as if she knew what her slave had been thinking. "Of course, If I don't treat my slave well, you won't last as long and then what could I use you for other than snack time?"

Hearing that, Tsukune bolted away from the smiling redheaded giantess. He stopped short and looked around, the desk he was on was up against a wall and completely bare of anything. He'd have had to jump. If Deshiko didn't catch him, he'd die from hitting the ground...assuming he survived, Deshiko would likely crush him or rip off a limb or two as punishment.

"Figured out escape's pointless, I see. That's too bad your a quick learner, I won't get to discipline you much. But I suppose you'll learn your position my slave quicker that way." Deshiko said thoughtfully.

Tsukune felt his blood freeze at the word "discipline", it was something he wanted to avoid at all costs, he had no illusions about how members of the Student Police Committee where when it came to punishments and discipline. He noticed right away that Deshiko seemed a little disappointed that he was a quick learner.

"Ho, calm down small-fry, I'm not going to kill you as long as you be a good slave, so really, your life-expectancy rate all depends on you." Deshiko said, amused by his fear. Ah...it felt GOOD to have authority again! Still, if he was too frightened, things wouldn't be as fun if he was too scared to even move. She decided to defuse the situation a little.

"Hmm...say shrimp, up for a few human games? I was thinking Cat and Mouse, Truth or Dare, Hide and Seek, Tag, soccer, wack-a-mole...you know, those kind of things." Deshiko said.

Tsukune nearly had a heart attack.

"Easy slave. I told you: if you die, how am I suppose to enjoy my slave as long?" the redhead pointed out.

"C-c-c-can't we do something simple, how about a card game?" Tsukune offered, feeling like he was going to wet himself.

Deshiko actually laughed, nearly making him go deaf.

"Man your a cowardly one! Still Still, I suppose in your position, sanity demands lack of bravado. No slave, I'm going to enjoy this to the fullest, I have a feeling of authority back and do you KNOW how rare a chance to overpower a S-class monster with just one foot is or how thrilling it is, even if its a Ghoul?"

Tsukune winced, thinking of Moka and Gin when they were at full power. It was a truly awe-inspiring level of terror to behold that kind of power in action. Taking that into account, he found it hard not to agree with Deshiko there. Thinking of Moka and Gin made him realise something.

"You know, my friends ARE going to look for me right?" he asked.

Deshiko shrugged. "Ahhh...none of them know where I live."

Tsukune paled, he hated that she was right. Even if they looked, his friends wouldn't find him.

Deshiko beamed at him with a smile he found unsettling, "So slave, ready to play." it wasn't actually a question, she wasn't giving him a choice.

Tsukune gulped "W-w-w-what game?"
155332222222211222221211112.title: Games!

1553322222222112222212111121.content:
The gigantic redhead leaned forward with a grin, her chin almost right before Tsukune's entire body. "What indeed? Cat and Mouse? I'm sure you'd absolutely love to fight against your goddess. Of course the end result would likely be you beneath my foot or palm."

Tsukune laughed nervously, "I'd...rather not."

"Rather?" Deshiko repeated with a sly smirk, "That means you have something you'd prefer to play. What is it my pet? I am a kind goddess, ask and you shall recieve."

The shrunken human reeled as his mind filled with fear and tension. "What now?! I have to choose a game!!" He mentally roared. He racked his mind but Tsukune couldn't come up with a "safe" game, Tag he's dead, Wack-a-mole, definitely dead, soccer...yeah none of these were looking pleasant.

"Whatever my goddess desires..." He finally mentioned with a bow, he figured it'd be best to just please Deshiko. She said so herself that as long as he behaved, he would live; now he had to believe her.

Taken slightly back by Tsukune's bow Deshiko smiled almost creepily, "Let me rephrase that. Decide on a game that I will enjoy or get ready for a very unpleasant day."

If Tsukune was scared before this took it to a whole new level, just from Deshiko's trademark power crazed smile he almost fainted. "Okay...um...." Tsukune tried to think of a safe game, and now he had a new condition; it had to be fun for his owner. What would keep him safe, not label him as a pervert and at the same time please Deshiko? It seemed impossible but Tsukune realized one game could possibly work.

"How about Truth or Dare?"

Deshiko held a finger along her lip as she thought it over, "Simple enough....could be fun...sure why not?"

Tsukune almost danced with joy, that is until Deshiko roughly poked him off of his feet. "BUT, you can't ask me to call your friends or let you go. You'll remain my pet until I say so...which is likely to never happen." Tsukune's demeanor reverted to the slumped form of him depressed when he rose back up, the sight actually turned his goddess on a tad.

Again Deshiko's lips curled into what was now becoming a very common sadistic smile, "Who shall go first?"

"Goddesses before slaves." Little Tsukune whimpered, still staring at the floor with a sad expression.

"Look at your goddess when you speak!"

Tsukune did just that as he repeated himself. Deshiko chuckled slightly, "Aww such a sweet slave. And a quick learner too. Okay truth or dare? Choose carefully."

Tsukune paled as he let out his choice.......
1553322222222112222212111121.title: Truth or Dare Monster Style

15533222222221122222121111211.content:
Tsukune didn't trust himself to choose the dare, who knew what Deshiko would do to him?!

"Truth."

Deshiko grinned like a Cheshire cat, making Tsukune almost wish he'd picked the dare.

"Ok then. I'll start with an easy one: why did the newspaper club stick they're noses into the business of the Student Police Committee?"

Tsukune sighed, that WAS an easy one, and was something he was grateful for.

"Ah...well, to be honest, we didn't even know the school HAD a Student Police Committee, we were just doing our jobs as members of the newspaper club until that super newspaper club showed up, we didn't want our club cut off and replaced. After Keito attacked us, we decided to fight back and find out why you guys would want us out of the way when we didn't even know the Student Police Committee existed until then."

Deshiko leaned back and groaned, rubbing her eyes. Figures. the Student Police Committee issued a challenged, they were answered. You couldn't invade someone and expect them not to fight back. You made more enemies by doing that.

"So we made enemies because we got in the way of people that weren't aware of the committee...that's just perfect!" the redhead muttered bitterly.

"Heheh...sorry." Tsukune said.

Deshiko pulled her hand away from her face and frowned at him. Half tempted to drain him into a shrivelled-up husk just to try getting rid of the headache that was forming at the news that the fraction she was part of had forced themselves to have more problems. No wonder the committee was seen as a joke, they'd arrested someone on false information and suspicion and had it blow up in they're faces, what was worse was that if it was ever made public that the actions of the Student Police Committee had forced a Ghoul to remove a seal on it's powers when it didn't want to hurt anyone, they'd become a liability and be seen as loose cannons that had to be put down. Just perfect.

Deshiko let out a deep, haggered sigh. "Don't be, just never speak of how the Student Police Committee forced you to expose your a Ghoul and we'll call it even."

Tsukune nodded, naturally he didn't like remembering how he'd nearly beenkilled by Kuyou anyways.

"So...we still doing truth or dare?" Tsukune asked.

Deshiko welcomed the change in topic. She nodded.

"Your ture to ask me."

"Hm...what game? Come to think of it...HM! That could be interesting!" Deshiko purred maliciously, giving the impression that she was licking her lips behind her helmet. After the downfall of the Student Police, she had lost the fear and respect she was given as a leader of the Student Police and had to endure regular verbal abuse by the students she once victimized.

Tsukune looked on as he captress set about retrieveing a chinese nesting doll along with a chinese checkers bord and a small black box, then proceeded to set the bord up then set the nesting doll off to the side next to him. Tsukune looked at the nesting doll and shivered. It was a misty bone white color with two blank eye-like blac spots.

"Admiering the nesting doll? That might be a good thing seeing as you might be sealed in it." Deshiko smirked.

Tsukune jumped back and away from it at that news. A magic prison in the shape of a nesting doll. Somehow he felt like he should have seen that coming, Wait... "You said 'might be'. What dose that mean?" the shrunken human asked her.

"Easy. If you win our little game, you stay outside the nesting doll and get to enjoy your...sort of-freedome since you're mine, little slave. If you loose, you get sucked into and trapped inside the nesting doll until I want to let you out.Seeing as I might have to put you inside it to make sure you don't run off or something, this way you'll get use to being in it." she told him, sounding as though it were obvious.

With that, Deshiko opened the box and inside were two metal beetles in it, one was red and the other was blue, Deshiko reached down and ran a finger along the red one and was soon enveloped in a swell of red light and energy that nearly blinded Tsukune and knocked him off his feet. Whe it stopped, he gaped.

Deshiko now wore a black suit overlaid by metallic crimson armor on her shoulders, chest, forearms, calves, hands, and feet. The armor on her chest vaguely resembled the shell of a beetle and accentuated her bust, while the backside of said armor resembled a pair of beetle wings. Her Visor was designed like a boomerang side-mounted on her left wrist, and her armored boots had small yet sharp heels on the soles that added to her height. Her helmet was just as crimson as the rest of her armor, with a grilled silver visor over her face designed to resemble the eyes and mandibles of an actual beetle. Twin antennae akin to those on a real longhorn beetle protruded from between the visor's eye-slits.

Fully armored, she then placed a scarab that looked like a plain blue beetle with six legs and two pincers in front of Tsukune and told him to touch it. As soon as he did so, the scarab shrunk down and seemed to unraval itself, only for it to reform as a bug-themed armor on Tsukune.

The armor it made looked like a black segmented metal body suit with six blue ovals from the hips down the legs, and blue circles on the tips of the fingers, the "boots" of the armor had thick blue armor over the knees, calves / shins, soles, and toes of the body while leaving the heel and instep bare, there was a segmented blue oval at the bend of the forearm, blue shoulder armor, a series of blue plates of armor covering the chest and sternum with an M-shaped pattern on the front of it, more blue plates forming up along the half of the neck and collar bone, and a large Blue Beetle on the back, its legs forming over the sides and shoulders of the body. The mask of the armor is also metal, yet allowed the mouth to open and close at will, blue armor forming over the back of the head and along the length of the lower jaw, the eyes of the mask were covered by yellow lenses, and large blue markings form around the eyes.

Tsukune stared at the blue-and-black beetle armor that he was now clad in and then stared as Deshiko picked him up and set him on the small stack of blue marles. As soon as he came into contact with them, the marbles opened up like pillbugs and took their positions on the game bord.

"Youkai-version of Chinese Checkers and they respond to willpower. Changes the way the marbles move in responce to the nature of who comes into contact to play with them, made for in case the monster in question dosen't have any limbs. The marbles are reading us as insectoid-type monsters thanks to the armor we're wearing. Seeing as you're too small to move them on your own without transforming, thought it would help you...besides, I don't want a Ghoul in my house while in it's true form." Deshiko said.

Tsukune nodded, feeling greatful for that, besides, it would make hiding he was human easier if these things COULD read true natures. So all he had to do was think which one he wanted moved and where for it to work, eh? Easy.

"I'll start." Deshiko said, sitting in a lotus position. A second later, one of her pieces became a pilbug again and moved into a diffrent notch on the chinese checkers board.

Seeing how it was done, Tsunke nodded and mirrored her. While he'd never played chinese checkers before, he hoped he won, who knew how long Deshiko would keep him locked in that nesting doll otherwise.

15533222222221122222122.content:
Ok then. how Keito be who find the shrunk Tsukune?

Keito's true form is a Jorougumo(a spider woman that has been known in Japanese legends). She injects poison into her fellow students to make them into her slaves[in simple terms:servants].In the 1st Season of the anime she tries to defeat the newspaper club but is defeated by Inner-Moka she was defeated in a mere 118seconds.
15533222222221122222122.title: Another member to choose...

choices: Keito decides to keep Tsukune as her pet and she'd enjoy him hearig her play
Keito goes with her original plan and eats Tsukune
155332222222211222221221.content:
Tsukune, too stunned to do anything else, assumed the feddle position and shed a tear as he could only IMAGIN how badly he was in trouble now. Youkai was bad enough at normal size, but now he'd SHRUNK!

A series of rythimic booms shook the ground, heading Tsukune's way and then they stopped.

"Eh? What the heck is﻿ this? A wittle tasty, tender, meaty, morsel McBugget?" someone cooed mockingly behind him as he was cast in someone's shadow.

Tsukune froze then looked behind him to see a a girl with long, dark lavender hair and matching colored eyes staring at him with a preditory smirk on.

Tsukune paled, even though she was wearing a regular, green school outfit opposed to her usual black one, he recognized her.

Keito, one of the members of the Student Police.

As soon as that registered with the shrunken human's brain, he turned and bolted as fast as he possably could.

The girl sprinted toward him, her stride purposeful, and looking straight down at Tsukune's position "You can run McBugget, but no matter what, I can still smell you! In fact..." She grinned, "...you almost smell like a human..."

The ground shook, jarring Tsukune, and a foot encased in a school loafer the size of a bus slammed into the ground about ten feet to the right. Another one slammed into the ground about thirty feet in front of Tsukune a split-second later, the heel facing him.

Tsukune slid to a halt as the nearer foot was lifted and the farther one spun around as the girl pivoted. Not a second later, Keito had lowered to her knees and her face was barely even a foot from him as she got onto her arms and legs as she grinned broadly when he turned around to dash back the way he's came, but she had no intention of letting him.

Tsukune gulped as Keito's hands, in a steepled position, fell on either side of him. He was trapped! He looked back at Keito and she was amused to see the sheer terror etched onto his face.

"Relax Shortie, I don't squish bugs..." Keito said soothingly, causing him to sigh in relife. She grinned and let out a demented giggle and before long was out right chackling as she assumed her true form.

Tsukune gaped as three sets of long, spindly, yellow and black spider legs sprouted from her abdomen, giving her the appearance of a humanoid insect while her mouth erupted in slimy mandibles not unlike that of an arachnid's. A wicked grin was still visible on her face despite the alterations to it.

"...I gobble them up!" the Jorōgumo finished cheerfully.

Tsukune paled, while he had seen her transform once before, his size and what she'd just said made it terrifying. She surprised him by opening her fingers for him to go through.

"Give me a good chace, little Tsukune!" Keito commanded in a husky, sultry tone.

Not needing to be told twice and more than happy to distance himself from the Jorōgumo, Tsukune bolted and made it less than a foot before he felt something sticky slam into him and wrap around him from the neck down. Looking down he was horrorified to see it was a ball of spider webbing that he was trapped in like a cacoon. She'd tricked him!

Keito stood and picked him up, laughing at his vulnerability.

"Now come on to my room, I'd just LOVE if you came for a bite to eat!" Keito said happily as she reassumed her human form and Tsukune had a whirlwind glimpse of the hallway and Keito’s shirt, seen from breast level as she walked to her dorm.

Getting to her room and locking the door, Keito stood in the middle of her room and looked at the human in her grasp.

"Don't worry tasty McBugget, THIS WON'T HURT A BIT!!"

Tsukune squirmed futially as he was raised into the air. Finally, Tsukune got a clear view of Keito's gargantuan face, before her hand went up a few more feet. The shrunk human watched as Keito opened her mouth wide open, and now he knew what was going to happen.

Panicing at the sight of her gaping maw, her tounge snaking out over her human form's teeth and beconing him into the dark cave of flesh and bone while strings of saliva hanging from her teeth, and the long dark tunnel leading into her stomach, Tsukune felt his blood become ice as she brought him slowly to her mouth, tormenting him with every second as she ever so slowly inched the hand that held him twords her waiting jaws to torment him with the terror of the ineveitable, gaining a primal thrill from the boy's obvious fear in the face of certain death. Tsukune shook his head furiously and begged her not to do it, to which Keito nodded and released the ball of web he was trapped in, causing him to scream as he free-fell only for Keito to catch him and raise him back to the first hight she'd dangled him from and inch him back to her mouth.

Tsukune looked away, he couldn't beleive he was going to die in Keito's gullet like this. That's when he spoted something that he hadn't expected to see. A biwa.

"You play?" Tsukune asked with a raised brow as he looked back at Keito. Honestly, he wasn't expecting something so normal from a member of the Student Police Committee. Given how they worked, he was surprised that she had a musical instrument rather than a midevil torture rack.

"Eh?" Keito said with a raised brow as she paused in lowering Tsukune into her mouth and looked around before she saw what had caused him to ask. When she did, she blushed in embaressment "S...so? I got that from my grandmother and she taught me, what of it?" she said defensivly.

"Nothing, but if you'd like, I'd like to listien to you play." Tsukune said as Keito closed her mouth and lowered him to her eye level,

"Listien to me..." the Jorōgumo said faintly, her cheeks blazing at the thought. A second later, Keito smacked Tsukune's web-ball onto her wall where it stuck, showing little reguard for the shrunk human's well-being seeing as she might just decide to eat him anyways like she planned on a moment ago, and she began to pace back and forth as she though about what to do. On one hand, she was feeling little hungry and Tsukune was the perfect size for a snack. On the other, Keito adored playing the instrument and this was the first time someone might get to hear her play seeing as everyone was too frightened by her SPC statuse to want anything to do with her and the rest of the Student Police couldn't care less about anything that didn't involve their authority being kept in tact, so none of them had any ear for music whatsoever at all. While Keito's melodies were beautiful, the fact that no one was around to hear her kotos other than the one who played them in the first place broke her heart. Yet here was Aono, offering to listien to her play, in both being willing and unwilling seeing as he couldn't escape her webbing until it desolved. Not that she'd let him get the chance to escape anyways...

Making up her mind, the Jorōgumo turned to Tsukune and smiled.

1553322222222112222212211.content:
Deciding to keep Tsukune a little longer, Keito went to pick up her biwa and said, "Okay Tsukune, I'll make you a deal. I'm going to play you a little concert and I want you to honestly tell me how you like it. If you tell me that you at least liked it, then I'll let you live and you become my personal pet and I'll keep the fact that I've shrunken you between the two of us, it'll be our "little" secret. But if you don't like it.... Well at least you were honest to your last breath, also don't you even dare think about lying to me, I'll know that you are, and I'll just eat you anyway."

Tsukune gulped as he got the point, and for his sake he hoped that Keito was very good with her biwa.

Just as she was about to begin, Keito said, "Just so you know...I've never played in front of a audience before and this does count in your decision of how good I am. Added onto that, my duties in the Student Police have made it that I've been so busy, I might have gotten a little out of practice."

Tsukune gulped and thought, 'That's not very reassuring...' "Uh...if it helps, just close your eyes and focus on the music then...small enough to overlook anyways..."

The violette-haired girl actually snickered at that, then Keito began playing her biwa. Sitting down with the short-necked fretted lute, she began to strum the plectrum across the strings.

To Tsukune, it was surprising. As she played, Keito seemed to relax and her features seemed to develop a calming glow to them as she immersed herself in the music, seeming to become like an entierly different person from the way the human knew.

Even as her eyes drifted shut, the Jorōgumo's fingers and the pick went along the strings with practiced ease and he was surprised when three sets of long, spindly, yellow and black spider legs sprouted from her abdomen and, seemingly unconsciously, the spider legs reached over and took out a Koto and set it up, all seemingly automatically and independent of Keito's will.

As soon as the spider legs finished setting up the Paulownia wood instrument, with the exception of strings, yet Keito, without disrupting her rhythm on the biwa, shot out strands of webbing from her mouth like a Spitting Spider and her legs threaded them along the koto. Once that was done, the spider legs started strumming along in seeming automatic.

The gentle sounds blended beautifully with one another, sure they were both sting instruments, but the ways they were played so that the music had one instrument go for high pitch while the other went low, while occasionally meeting in the middle as they swapped tones...it was actually very classy.

Was this really the same person that had been part of the student police officers? The same girl that was ruthless and prone to employing violence, intimidation, and other immoral actions in order to further the Public Safety Commission's agenda, which was to extort Yōkai Academy's student body of money and impose their militant vision of law upon the school? He almost couldn't believe it!

After her concert for the shrunken human was finished, Keito looked at Tsukune with anticipation of her performance and asked, "Well, what did you think?"

Tsukune was now thinking really hard on how to tell Keito on what he thought of her personal concert she played for him and he knew that his truthful answer could either save his life, or kill him and in the end he came to a decision and said, "Keito, I think that your concert was...

Sokka slept soundly in his blue sleeping bag, his mouth open and drooling. His sleeping form showed no signs of discomfort, but that changed quickly. His body then started to convulse spastically, though he did not wake up. All his muscles contracted at once and he began to grind his teeth.

Though Sokka himself couldn't feel it, his body began to shrink at an amazing rate. His sleeping bag was soon like a tunnel compared to him. Still he slept on, undisturbed even as a hand carefully picked him out of the clothe tube and started to walk away from the camp.

Sokka awoke with his normal fight to remain asleep, but the sight of a giant foot and leg snapped him awake faster than any caffienated beverage. He was now at the giant feet of...

1553322222222211212.content:
Towering over him with her arms crossed and a look of smug satisfaction on her face was the princess of the Fire Nation, Azula. Her perfectly pedicured foot tapped slowly on the ground, sending small tremors which almost made Sokka lose his balance. They stared at each other for a moment, neither said anything for almost a minute until Azula broke the silence.

"Hello there little water tribesman. I hope you're in a talkative mode, because then this will be a much nicer experience for you." She gave him a hard poke in the stomach with her big toe, knocking him onto his back before pinning him beneath her toe. "Now, why don't you tell me the plans for the invasion."

While the FIre Nation was already well aware of the invasion planned for the day of the eclipse, knowing details was essential to avoid massive collateral damage on the infrastructure.

"Don't pretend like you don't know anything, I already know you are the brains behind the majority of the invasion. So why don't you make this easier on yourself and tell me now?"

Sokka glared into the gleaming amber eyes of the princess and shouted his response.

"HELL NO!"

"I thought so," Azula deadpanned, "looks like I get to have some fun afterall."
1553322222222211212.title: the Fire Nation princess, Azula

1553322222222211221.content:
During his hunt for the Avatar, Prince Zuko of the Fire Nation had run across an old shrine on a small island which looked like it hadn't seen visitors in decades. A shrine which he failed to give proper respect to, despite his uncle telling him to do so repeatedly, and now brought down the wrath of the spirits upon his head.

Zuko had yet to find any sign of the avatar since he had started on his task, and was on his way to the south pole when they ran across the shrine. When he should have bowed and prayed respectfully for the spirits' favor, he instead turned his head, scoffed, and uttered insults directed at the so-called spirits of the shrine, an act which was taken as a great offense, and one which would be rightfully punished by dawn the next day.

His dreams had been plagued by phantoms and bad memories, and his body moved restlessly along with it. Soon he would know the wrath of scorned otherworldly beings with supernatural powers, and he would rue the day he had disrespected them.

Zuko woke the next morning in full Fire Nation armor, and saw a massive foot directly in front of him, with the eyes of its owner locked on to his form. He was currently...
1553322222222211221.title: Zuko

15533222222222112211.content:
Cerulean eyes gazed down at the form of the disgraced Fire Nation prince. They belonged to a girl around his age, whose skin was a deep tan and hair was done up in a braid with two hair loops that went from the top of her head into the base of her braid. Zuko recognized what she was immediately. The blue dyed layered clothing fringed by white fur, it could only be the clothing worn by those of the water tribe. The vagrant prince soon realized that he was no longer on his ship, but rather one of the planets two poles. The girl squatted down so her knees were at her chest, and took a good, long look at him. Her eyes then narrowed menacingly.

Katara noticed the moving speck when she entered her room. It was tiny, and there was nothing that lived in the South Pole that she knew of that was that small. She looked closer, and saw that the thing seemed to realize it was being watched. What she thought was its head was clearly pointed in her direction, and it had taken an apprehensive stance. Getting lower to the ground, Katara got her first good look at it, and recognized what it was quickly after. It was bipedal, and it bore a Fire Nation uniform. Before her was a tiny member of the Fire Nation military. The same military that took Katara's mother from her, and she planned to take her restitution. This little soldier would pay for what his nation did with his sweat and tears.

The giant hand shot forward at Zuko, and the prince dodged as well as he could in hopes of a safe get away.

15533222222222132.content:
Aang had originally been trying to get back into the Spirit World...again. He didn't remember doing anything different than before. Breathe in, breathe out, empty all his thoughts of worldly attachments, the whole shebang. He even felt the numbing tingle in his body whenever he transitioned from the mortal realm to the Spirit World. But when he opened his eyes, he was not in the Spirit World. He seemed, rather, to be in a giant forest, as he was surrounded by tall green trees that towered over him.

"Whoa," Aang muttered, "That's new...I'm pretty sure this isn't the Spirit World...but I don't remember anything like this..."

Aang then heard the ground rumble and the sky above him get darker. That was when Aang started to realize the 'trees' were not trees at all. It was grass. REALLY tall grass. And much to his surprise, he saw the face of the earthbending teacher, Toph Bei Fong, towering over him.

"Did I...did I SHRINK?" Aang asked with a startling realization.

"Sure did, Twinkle Toes," Toph said, somehow able to perfectly hear him despite the size difference, "Consider this...endurance training."


How does Toph plan to test Aang's survival skills?

Hei, The Black Reaper, was prowling the streets of Tokyo at night. The midnight shined like a familiar friend. On his hitlist for the night was a Contractor whose ability allowed her to bestow growing and shrinking powers on others, as well as use them herself. Another problem was that the abilities supposedly drove those endowed with them insane.

Hei then witnesses a mugging between a 12 foot tall woman and a 4 foot man. It must have been her. There was no other explanation at the moment.

Grappling down to face the Contractor, Hei saw that the woman was beautiful. But that would not stop him from taking her down. Although her increased size made her somewhat dangerous, Hei managed to stop her mugging. However, he still had to take her out, and not in the way he might've liked considering her looks. Ah, the drawbacks of being an assassin or mercenary or spy on occasion...you never get close enough to anyone.

But there would be time to reflect on that later. She was escaping, and Hei followed her relentlessly. She disappeared at a two-way street. Hei could either go left or right. He decided to go:

1553322222222221211.content:
Turning around the corner to the left, Hei froze in his tracks. The Black Reaper had faced many a foe, but none were huge as this one. An 18-foot Amber stood in front of him, motioning seductively with her fingers.

"How did Amber get so huge? Regardless, I have to know where Pai is so..." Hei thought to himself.
Hei looked up to Amber's gigantic, pretty, sociopathic face and spoke still with confidence. "Amber, where is Pai?"

"Hmm...not even a "Wow, funny running into you here..." or a "You've grown since we last met"? And here I thought we were more than friends..."

"We've never been friends" Hei said, as he looked away from her, haunted by her betrayals. Amber's golden eyes seemed to drip tears upon Hei's previous statement, but nothing came out.

Amber clenched her fists and said, "I only came back to offer you a position with Evening Primrose...and me...but it seems you don't like me..."

"Is that giant woman involved with your organization?"

"Of course, how do you think I got like this? I sent her to lure you...right back to my clutches..."

"...Why?"

"What a trivial question. Because Contractors aren't made insane by their abilities, like so many think...we just decide based on reason not emotion. My emotions wanted you, the reasonable lover was you, and so I reasoned a plan to get you, that didn't involve me until the end so my emotions wouldn't get in the way. Simple enough for a small lil' guy like you?"

Hei drew his blade, knowing although it was small, he could still fight. And he had to subdue Amber, and find out where his sister, Pai, was...and Amber knew. He knew she knew...he could see it in her now over-sized eyes.

Amber saw the blade and said, "Ooh...what a small blade? You wanna fight, lil' Hei?"

Hei then jumped towards Amber and...
1553322222222221211.title: Left, and Hei meets a giant Amber.

Hei grappled around Amber, dodging her attacks seemlessly. He may have been small, but he was still the Black Reaper. And he could win this. He'd fought and beaten numerous opponents, even in the Heaven's War, where he had no power. Swinging and stabbingly methodically, he seemed to not even be harming Amber.

But she couldn't touch him either. He also knew just how to beat her. Super-charging an electrical burst, he sent it straight through a small wound he inflicted on Amber. The electricity jolted through Amber's body. Amber fell to her knees, as Hei moved out of the path of the giantess' fall.

However, Amber started...giggling?

Yes, Amber still wasn't through. She snapped her fingers and out of nowhere, Brita came. Except she teleported herself, Yin (who could track people through water) and April (who could make it rain) there with her. And they were all giants. The glazed look in their eyes indicated they weren't themselves.

Of course, Brita's power teleports people out of their clothing too, but Hei had more important things on his mind. Like surviving.

15533222222222221.title: Lil Yusuke?

choices: Botan, returning to warn Yusuke to never point the tool at himself
Keiko here to chew Yusuke out for ditching class
155332222222222211.content:
Long, dull, and lifeless; those were the three words Yusuke Urameshi would have used to describe his school life. His friend Kuwabara sat in the corner of the class asleep, drooling slightly, and his friend/girlfriend Keiko was beside him vigorously taking notes and keeping Yusuke awake. Here he was in the middle of class listening to some lady teaching about something she has no knowledge about, giving work...it was too much of a pain. In fact, he probably would have skipped school today if not for Keiko.

--------------------------------------------------------
That Morning

"Ugh what a pain...getting up early every morning sucks..." Yusuke yawned, the sun was barely even up. Beside him were his friends Kuwabara and Keiko. Like Yusuke Kuwabara was a guy who despised school and looked exhausted....but Keiko seemed as lively as ever; as well as slightly angry at Yusuke.

"Oh come on Yusuke! You've spent most of the school year fighting demons in tournaments, plots and whatever! Your Mom and Shizuru had to beg to the school for you not to get expelled...again! The least you can do is go to school once a month."

Yusuke groaned, "Speaking of once a month your attitude sa-" He got cut off by a clean slap from Keiko and a collision course with the ground.

Kuwabara bent over and helped him get up, "Man she outta be the Spirit Detective."

"Yeah...." Yusuke touched his cheek and winced at the stinging pain, but oddly soon grinned afterwards. "Why it looks like I have a medical emergency."

Kuwabara caught his drift and began grinning too, "I hear the arcade has medicine."

"Let's go."

"OH NO YOU DON'T!!" Keiko screamed, both guys turned around and looked at her. "You guys are coming to school or else!" The look in Keiko's face alone told them they should listen, she was not above telling Shizuru about Kuwabara bailing and she was more than enough for Yusuke. The two sighed.

---------------------------------------

And we ended up here.... God Yusuke was so tempted to just shoot a solid Spirit Gun at his teacher....but he'd behave for now. Least class would be over in a few minutes. Tap tap tap....something was knocking on something...but it wasn't the door it was...the window? He turned to see and a loud scream of surprise came out.

"Botan!!"

The pink kimono wearing girl smiled and waved from the otherside of the window, "Hey Yusuke. Head out here, I need to talk to you." It was the perfect excuse, Yusuke ran right on out of the class without so much as a word of explanation. In a couple seconds he was out front with Botan standing before him.

"What do ya want Botan? I swear to god if Koenma has another job for me he can ju-"

"I'm here to give you something Yusuke."

Yusuke blinked in slight surprise, "Give me something?"

Botan nodded, "Yeah, a new Spirit Detective tool." She rifled around in her kimono before pulling out what appeared to be a short knife. "The Spirit Knife! Guaranteed to weaken any enemy you use it on!"

Yusuke snatched it from her hand, it looked like a regular pocket knife. "This weakens demons? How?" Botan hopped on her broomstick and gave him a last look, "Just push the button!" And before Yusuke knew it she began to fly away.

"Hey wait!!!" But it was too late, Botan was gone. "Damn girl....still this is a tool?" Yusuke looked around the knife and found a small red button at the hilt, nothing else. "Aw screw it, lets see what this so called weapon does." Yusuke pushed the bottom and immediately a small beam of energy escaped the blades tip and hit Yusuke square in the face. "I really hate that girl..." Were the last words he said before the knife took effect.

It's effects were almost instant, the world...everything began growing larger at an astounding rate. They aren't getting bigger...I'm getting smaller!! The shrink went on and Yusuke nearly cursed at himself....but he didn't because a certain someone came as soon as the shrinking stopped...
155332222222222211.title: Being a Spirit Detective Sucks....

15533222222222222222222211.title: No Good Little Tsuna?

155332222222222222222222111.content:
The Mafia, when one says that what crosses your mind? Thugs, crooks, bad guys? How about a cowardly teenage boy? Most likely not, but that was what Tsuna Sawada was. The young man was well on his way to becoming the Tenth Boss of the Vongola Mafia family, whether he liked it or not; and he did not. For the vast majority of his life Tsuna was…well, no good; hence his school nickname No-Good-Tsuna. Bad grades, bad athletics, no friends; Tsuna was the pinnacle of sad cases. But that all changed when one person showed up, a tutor hired by his mother. An infant by the name of Reborn. Now, Reborn seemed odd right off the bat, but things grew only weirder as he talked about making Tsuna a Mafia Boss, and through his effective, if not odd, training methods, Tsuna went through leaps and bounds of growth in a mere two years. Much of it thanks to a special bullet that allowed Tsuna to do supernatural things, a bullet called the Dying Will Bullet.

No longer did people call him no good, Tsuna was now actually fairly popular. No longer was he alone, he had a great deal of friends now, people who Reborn referred to as his “Mafia Family.” But to Tsuna, they were simply his friends. Tsuna’s physical abilities had evolved from pathetic to superhuman through Reborn’s tutelage. And most significantly, it brought Tsuna much closer to his life-long crush Kyoko. With the Mafia affairs Tsuna found himself with he had no time for romance though. He had already battled other mafia, an assassination group, and even travelled to the future! Each fight causing Tsuna to grow and develop at an amazing pace; but it did nothing to change his attitude regarding his feelings toward the Mafia. One day, Reborn decided to try a different approach about that.

It wasn’t a particularly special day, clouds, sunlight…a nice typical Saturday, which Tsuna enjoyed with the rare act of sleeping in. After his adventures 10 years in the future Tsuna had earned a well deserved break…It was sadly short-lived though, as memories of his past encounters…the cruelties he had seen surfaced in the form of nightmares. People he knew were suffering, he was getting beat…his friends were hurt…it was horrifying enough to shock Tsuna awake.

“Ahh!!!” Tsuna sat upright, sweat on his brow. He scanned his room for things from his nightmares, letting out a sigh of relief. “Whew…only a dream…”

“Ciaossu.”

“AAAHHH!!!” Tsuna jumped right out of his bed, right behind him was the person who greeted him, and still to this day never ceased to scare him, Reborn.

The infant smirked towards his pupil, “About time you woke up, I’ve got something I need to ask you.”

“What is it Reborn?”

Reborn was utterly serious in tone, “Have you accepted your role as the Tenth Vongola Boss yet?”

Tsuna frowned, “Oh not this again!! Come on Reborn! I keep telling you, I don’t want to be a Mafia Boss!!”

The tutor lowered his head, “I see…I guess I have no choice…”

The young Vongola appeared nervous, whenever Reborn got like this bad things tended to happen…

Reborn pointed his gun at Tsuna, “In that case…” Tsuna couldn’t react before a single gunshot was fired, aimed directly at his heart. Were it a regular bullet the shot would have murdered Tsuna instantly, but it was no regular bullet. It was the Dying Will Bullet; which, when fired at specific spots had special abilities. The heart was a new spot to be shot at though…what would happen? Tsuna couldn’t tell as his vision grew blurry, and then…black.

Reborn looked sternly at Tsuna, “One day you’ll thank me for this…”


It wasn’t until about five hours later Tsuna awoke, the memory of Reborn shooting him fresh in his mind. “Reborn!! What did he do to me this time?!” Tsuna looked over his body, no changes…nothing different, nothing at all. Was it a dud? Then Tsuna looked up, and his jaw went down.

Everything in his room, every little thing, was hundreds…no thousands of times bigger! Were it any of his friends they would have spouted nonsense, but Tsuna had common sense; he had shrunken! Tsuna clasped his chest in shock, he was shot in the heart and the Dying Will Bullet shrank him!!? Damn that Reborn! But at least he saw fit to put Tsuna back on his bed…that was a plus. “I guess Reborn’s bullet wasn’t a dud…”

“ACHOO!!!!!!!”

Good god if Tsuna wasn’t already on edge! Out of nowhere came this loud, typhoon of a sneeze that threatened to deafen the poor child. The shockwave from the sneeze knocked poor Tsuna onto his back, it came from behind him, so he managed to find the cause, and gasped.

He was not alone, there was someone on his bed, someone extremely attractive…

He said if can overcome the challenges ahead...you'll be willing to accept the title of Mafia Boss."She explaied. She reached down, plucking up the tiny teen between her thumb and forefinger.

Tsuna was surprised to see how easily he could dissapear into the pores on her finger. He must've been ridiculously tiny to Chrome, a speck....

"Reborn said to give you three challenges..."She straightened out her legs, still sitting on the bed."For the first challenge.....strength......or was it endurance?"

She reached over, placing him just below her pinky toe."For this challenge, Reborn told me to press down for five minutes. If you can survive that, long, you moveon to the sceond challenge...."She recalled the infant hitman's words.

It's the challenge of wisdom."She looked away for a moment, trying to recall the rest of the speech."There will be five questions. You need to get just two right to pass."

15533222222222222222222221211.title: Good Guy

155332222222222222222222212111.content:
Superheroes, those who take the personal responsibility to battle evil and any who harm the innocent; when one thinks about such a topic, the typical image is Superman, Batman, or Wonder Woman, some person who seems perfect in their fight for justice. No one thought about a group of super-powered teenagers, no one would think the youth would take such a burden. But there was such a group, a group of teenagers dedicated to fighting crime. Beast Boy, the shape-shifter and overall mischief maker, Cyborg, the cybernetic superhuman with a heart of gold and a passion for video games, Starfire, the unusual alien woman with abnormal strength, energy attacks, and a child-like innocence, Raven, the dark one with a kind soul and powers in the dark arts; and last but not least, Robin, the boy wonder and leader of the heroes. This ragtag group of teenagers formed the Teen Titans, and, despite the occasional petty squabble, always got along stupendously. But their leader always seemed to bear the burden upon himself instead of with his friends; during such times he was usually alone, training himself to the limit, such as the current case.

It was a gymnasium sort of room built specifically for Robin, in which he trained by lifting weights and beating on practice dummies, which he currently was. On his mind was the one villain who always eluded him, the one who always seemed to be one step ahead, Slade. He had to get stronger, he had to beat him and bring him to justice! It was an obsession, an obsession his friends knew full well. They worried for him constantly, one day he would push too hard and then…None of them wanted to think of the last part. If nothing was done soon, it would go too far. And it seemed, someone did in fact, have a plan, because Robin was not alone in that room. There was someone, hiding right behind the door.

Robin, too focused on his training, didn’t notice them until a faint beam of light went from the person to him. Instantly he began to descend into unconsciousness, but not before giving his attacker a look. He was already mid-fall when he saw the person. “You…? I know you….wh…….” He couldn’t finish, he was unconscious.

The mystery person, a woman, walked towards the hero. “Too slow Robin…but don’t worry, you’ll wake up soon enough.” A faint chuckle could be heard as the woman saw Robin’s cape become a little bigger on the hero.

---------------------------

“Ah!!! Get back!” Robin sat upright, screaming. The last thing he remembered was an ambush…then he passed out. He looked around, no one, not even a familiar terrain. Just blue trees that seemed to rise to about his height, so thick they formed a never ending forest. The sky was unusually dark, maybe it was night…and the blue trees…some kind of alien planet? Wouldn’t be the first time. Also, he was uninjured, although he did seem to lose his clothes somewhere along the line. He was naked in a random blue forest.

One of those dreams eh…? Robin wondered, had he trained so hard he passed out? Maybe imagined being attacked out of paranoia? It sounded possible, not unheard of. Having a naked dream was a rarity though, nothing he had to be ashamed of; after all, it was a dream.

“Heh, pretty clear headed for a dream…I must be sleeping like a rock. I probably need to take more breaks.”

A massive, unrecognizable form stepped into his path. “You do need to rest a little bit more, but this is no dream.” It was a voice, a voice thundering like God itself. But where did it come from?

Robin looked up, and instantly realized his situation in a heartbeat. For one thing, he was shrunken; his location was some bedroom with carpeting to resemble a forest. The sky was a ceiling so far away he couldn’t even make out details like the light in the center. The massive form were treads, the treads of a boot; a boot that rose as high as a building, leading to a pair of legs that rose into infinity. The person before him was bigger than any building he’d ever seen before, and Robin had been to Gotham! In fact, everything past the shin was a blur; and the voice of the person was so echoed and loud it was unrecognizable, hardly even understandable. And, of course, Robin realized this was no dream. He was shrunken before some girl who was bigger than he could ever imagine.

The woman who was a blur laughed, “Speechless? I guess so, I would be too if I were that small. If I were to something as big as what I seem I’d probably faint.”

Was this woman toying with him? Robin quickly felt his temper flare, “Don’t toy with me! Why did you shrink me!?”

It was all so blurry, but it looked like the girl was flipped his wrist. “Sorry Robin, but you’re so small it’s all squeaks to me. But I’m guessing it’s something about why I shrunk you? Am I right?”

Robin didn’t answer; he was too focused on figuring out who this girl was. But she was just so damn blurry! All he got were colors and a vaguely feminine voice; anything he could see was unreadable.

The giantess took his silence as an answer, “Oh yeah, you can’t really reply? Well, truth be told…I didn’t mean for you to get this small. It was a mistake on my part. But it was either this small, smaller, or regular size; so I went with this. And no need to feel modest about your…outfit, I can’t make out anything anyway…you must be pretty small down there.”

Robin both blushed and covered his groin; he completely forgot he was naked before this girl! “Stop playing around! Who are you!?”

“And I’m guessing now you want me to stop messing around with you. Honestly, I can understand being mad but you seem to be overdoing it a bit….unless…You can’t see me can you? Am I just a blur up here? Squeak once for yes, none for no.”

Robin screamed “Yes,” One time.

The giantess let out what seemed to be a small chuckle, “My bad, again, your size was…unexpected. I didn’t prepare properly.” The massive figures of her boots slid an immeasurable distance away, replaced by what Robin could only guess were her knees. Enormous clouds of dust flew into the air from the impact of the two joints, each landing with a thud that rang in Robin’s ears. On a brief perverted impulse his eyes trailed along from the knees the woman’s thighs, blushing a bit at the sight; but it did prove fruitful, because he recognized the skin tone of the legs and started piecing it together. He should’ve realized when he first saw her legs before, but the boots obscured most of his view on that matter. The woman leaned her face in all the way until her nose was inches away from touching the carpet fibers Robin stood with. Her every breath brought forth a decent wind which warmed the hero’s body. Her pupils alone were the size of five Robin’s, her lips could have been buildings themselves.

Up close, Robin realized who it was in an instant; feeling stupid for not realizing it…the type of boots…the skin tone, hell he even saw her before he passed out! He just never put the pieces together. Now he did.

The giantess’ lips parted to say a single thing….

The young crimefighter appeared flustered at the words. "Y...you what?"

"Oh enough," the voice answered, its force nearly enough to send him off his feet. "I know you have feelings for me, as I do for you, and this way we can express all those feelings without anyone else noticing. Now keep still, since I do not want to harm you."

The next thing Robin saw was what appeared to be two orange skyscrapers descending from the sky, trapping him between them. He could only gasp as they placed a tremendous amount of force on his body, while recognizing what they were. If she put even the tiniest bit of force into the two fingers, his entire body would be splattered. Despite his miniscule scale, his apprehension could still be seen by Starfire.

"I told you friend Robin, please do not move. This will not take long."

What happened next was similar to being flung at supersonic speed. Robin flew through the air, struggling to deal with the forces projected through the wind tunnel created by Starfire's fingers, only for the force to suddenly stop and the pressure of the fingers to have gone. Checking his body to ensure that he was unhurt, the Boy Wonder dusted himself off and looked on at the area he landed in. And he gasped.

He was on what appeared to be a notable field of brown flesh with an endless orange expanse surrounding it. Namely, he was right on top of Starfire's naked breast, an expansive mountain high above the ground. Her face was no longer visible from where he was due to his miniscule scale, but her voice was still as clear and forceful as ever.

"Go ahead friend Robin. My breasts are now yours to play on. Please, feel free to explore."

The heat from her body made him sweat even with no clothes on. A wonderful scent reminiscent of flowers filled the air (which honestly surprised Robin, who half expected the smell of mustard). Placing his hands on the ground, the skin was smooth and soft to the touch, the feeling driving him wild. Starfire offered him all this, and facing the mountain of female flesh in front of him, he was more than eager to accept the gift. Unfortunately, as he was about to fling himself onto said breast, a lingering though entered his brain uninvited.

**********************************************

If you're going to go off to another city to fight crime, I won't stop you. The bird needs to leave the nest eventually.

So you're not going to throw a hissy fit?

I'm going to give you some advice. First, always have a backup plan. I saw that place you're working out of. Calling it an easy target would be generous.

What else?

Be professional. If I find out you were acting in a way that makes not just you look bad, but makes me look bad, I'll come after you.

What's that supposed to mean?!

It's why I don't play well with others. I don't let personal feelings get in the way of my goals. And they shouldn't get in your way either. If you can't focus your entire self on fighting crime, then you'll mess up. And if you mess up, you'll hurt someone. I will not let it get to that point. Understand?

**********************************************************************

Snapping back to reality, Robin realized that he wasn't supposed to be here. It was why he always kept Star at arm's length despite their shared affection. The words of his mentor echoed through his mind, if he gave into temptation, that he would come after him.

This was exactly what was Bruce was talking about before that fateful day.

"Go on Robin," Starfire's voice interrupted, the noise shaking him to the core, "do not be shy. I know you want this."

But in the face of this leviathan, all that seemed unimportant. He was truly an insect, yet one being allowed free reign. The heat of her body and the touch of her skin drove him mad, yet the years of training instilled in him urged resistance. Pondering for a brief moment, Robin made his choice.

Madame Rouge had grown impatient, and with her latest stomp she threw in a surprise, her hand. Her hand quickly caught the Boy Wonder midair, and proceeded to retract back into place as Rouge held the hero before her face. "Not bad for a bug. But I tire of this game…"

1553322222222222222222222222222222221111.content:
Contrary to his own logic and common sense, everything seemed to be getting bigger. But even if he was not a brilliant detective, he still deduced, based on the fuzzy, numbing feeling of his own body, that these were not external changes. The changes were all happening to him. The world wasn't getting bigger. He was getting smaller. The one thing he couldn't explain was why his clothes shrunk with him, especially since that's the opposite of what happened when he was first transformed into a child by the men in black. This seemed to be a different kind of drug, one that physically shrunk him rather than reverse his aging.

In his perfect world, he would be able to start searching for answers to his predicament and figure out a way to solve the case. Or he could have just waited for Professor Agasa to come home and explain just what exactly was in that bonbon that caused him to shrink. Unfortunately, neither scenario happened as someone else had come into the professor's house for their own reason...
